question:
Which of the following were the consequences of the invasion of Nadir Shah?
1. Nadir Shah allowed Muhammad Shah to remain on the throne of Delhi but he annexed all territories west of the Indus including Kabul.
2. He also demanded that a sum of twenty lakhs-out of the revenue of the four districts of Gujarat, Sialkot, Pasrur and Aurangabad.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Muhammad Shah was allowed by Nadir Shah to remain on the throne of Delhi but he annexed all territories west of the Indus including Kabul. Along with this he also demanded that a sum of twenty lakhs-out of the revenue of the four districts of Gujarat, Sialkot, Pasrur and Aurangabad.
